alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:37PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne and central Pulaski Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 136 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mill Springs, or 7 miles north of Monticello, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mill Springs and Betsey around 140 PM EDT. Frazer and Naomi around 145 PM EDT. Pulaski County Park, Quinton, Nancy and Kidder around 150 PM EDT. Burnside, Bronston, General Burnside S.P. and Tateville around 155 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Somerset, Elihu, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Ruth, Grade, Dykes, Dabney, Bent, Shopville, Valley Oak and Mount Victory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
